revised_title: The Non-Existence of Sugar in Diabetic Blood
tldr: The author, William Hyde Wollaston, conducted experiments to determine if sugar exists in the blood of people with diabetes mellitus. Using a new method of coagulating serum, he found no trace of sugar in the blood samples he examined. This discovery challenged the existing understanding of diabetes and led to further research on the disease's nature and treatment.
